Yes, there are also several studies that highlight the benefits of technology use in education. Here are a few examples:

1. A study published in the Journal of Educational Computing Research found that incorporating technology into classroom instruction can lead to higher levels of student engagement and motivation, as well as improved academic performance.

2. Another study published in the Journal of Educational Psychology found that digital technology can support student learning by providing opportunities for collaboration, communication, and personalization of learning.

3. A meta-analysis conducted by researchers at Duke University found that technology-based interventions can be effective in increasing student achievement, particularly in STEM subjects.

These studies suggest that technology use in classrooms can have positive effects on student learning and engagement. Technology can provide new opportunities for learning that may not have been possible otherwise, such as online resources, interactive simulations, and digital collaboration tools. 

However, it is important to note that the effectiveness of technology-based interventions can vary depending on several factors, including the quality of the instructional design, the characteristics of the learner, and the context of the learning environment. Additionally, the appropriate amount and type of technology usage can vary depending on the specific subject matter, age group, and other contextual factors.
